greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n into relatively prime parts that are all greater than 1.
comment: Two or more numbers are relatively prime if they have no common divisor other than 1. A single number is not considered relatively prime unless it is equal to 1 (which is impossible in this case).
The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A302697.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: The a(5) = 1 through a(12) = 7 partitions (empty column indicated by dot):
maple: b:= proc(n, i, g) option remember; `if`(n=0, `if`(g=1, 1, 0),
`if`(i<2, 0, b(n, i-1, g)+b(n-i, min(n-i, i), igcd(g, i))))
mathematica: Array[a, 60] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 10 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: A002865 does not require relative primality.
A302697 gives the Heinz numbers of these partitions.
A337451 is the ordered strict version.
A337485 is the pairwise coprime instead of relatively prime version.
A078374 counts relatively prime strict partitions.
A291166 appears to rank relatively prime compositions.
A332004 counts strict relatively prime compositions.
A337561 counts pairwise coprime strict compositions.
A338332 is the case of length 3, with strict case A338333.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 11 2018
